name: Global airline traffic and capacity (ICAO)
title: Global airline traffic and capacity (ICAO)
description: The source notes that "Traffic and operations data below reflects the systemwide scheduled activity of passenger and cargo airlines operating worldwide, as recorded by ICAO; domestic operations within the former USSR are excluded prior to 1970."

sources.name: International Civil Aviation Organization via Airlines for America (2023)
sources.additionalInfo: The source notes that "Traffic and operations data below reflects the systemwide scheduled activity of passenger and cargo airlines operating worldwide, as recorded by ICAO; domestic operations within the former USSR are excluded prior to 1970."

fields.name: ASKs
fields.description: In the airline industry available kilometers is a measure of passenger carrying capacity. It is equal to the number of seats available multiplied by the number of kilometers flown. An available seat km is the fundamental unit of production for a passenger-carrying airline.

fields.name: Cargo RTKs
fields.description:
The number of revenue tonnes of cargo (freight and mail) carried multiplied by the
distance flown.

fields.name: Freight Tonnes
fields.description: The number of revenue tonnes of freight transported by air.

fields.name: PLF
fields.description: The passenger load factor (PLF) measures the ratio of actual passengers to the available seats. It effectively measures the percentage of available seats that are taken by actual passengers.

fields.name: RPKs
fields.description: The number of revenue passengers carried multiplied by the distance flown.
